Physical Exam: Inspection of the throat and vocal cords using a laryngoscope
Justification: To visually assess the vocal cords for any signs of inflammation, lesions, or other abnormalities that could be causing hoarseness.

Physical Exam: Palpation of the neck for lymphadenopathy
Justification: To check for swollen lymph nodes that may indicate an infection or other underlying condition.
To evaluate for any lesions, redness, or other abnormalities that could contribute to throat discomfort.
To rule out any respiratory issues that may be contributing to the hoarseness.

Physical Exam: Evaluation of the patient's voice quality and pitch
Justification: To assess the characteristics of the hoarseness and determine if there are any changes in voice production.
